posts.post_content:
I like this card but I hate the fact that every time someone decides to put a turn one game-winning combo on these pages the assume that you have in your opening hand of seven cards four of these, four Black Lotus and the cards that you need to actually win the game.
  
   
Grrr.

Posted By: Concerned_Bystander (3/8/2011 5:43:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I want this back, especially with some cool new art.  
  
But I disagree with your comment about the color pie, it's always been there. It might be more apparent now since cards are becoming more and more complicated. But the color pie is what makes the game fun. I wanna build some crazy counter heavy deck? Well then I'm gonna either have a blue deck, or a crazy combo with the other colors. Putting counters in green casually would make a monster.  
  
Same with any color specific ability, I don't even think this goes against blacks theme all that much. Short temporary mana advantage. It's not like Overgrowth or anything. It's practically just card disadvantage unless you have just the right cards. And in the later game, unless you're casting a [Consume Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consume Spirit) it's almost worthless.
posts.html:
I want this back, especially with some cool new art.

But I disagree with your comment about the color pie, it's always been there. It might be more apparent now since cards are becoming more and more complicated. But the color pie is what makes the game fun. I wanna build some crazy counter heavy deck? Well then I'm gonna either have a blue deck, or a crazy combo with the other colors. Putting counters in green casually would make a monster.

Same with any color specific ability, I don't even think this goes against blacks theme all that much. Short temporary mana advantage. It's not like Overgrowth or anything. It's practically just card disadvantage unless you have just the right cards. And in the later game, unless you're casting a Consume Spirit it's almost worthless.

posts.post_content:
Read has Bolt back.  
  
I don't see any reason not to reprint this - **except** for modern WotC's pride. It would mean admitting that the game was just-plain-better back then and that all their "color pie" nonsense has become a weight around MtG's neck.

posts.post_content:
Love this card. Not a game winning combo but it's pretty ridiculous, Turn 1: Dark Ritual into a Bog Witch... lolwut?

posts.post_content: this has always been one of my favorites. when i first started playing i though i was something being able to play this then throw out a priest of gix and use his mana to play either another and then/or another piddly 3 mana creature. man, love this guy. this whole saga rocked, and dark ritual helped to make that happen.

Posted By: thewalkingdead (7/26/2011 7:13:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: That this version was printed with the bizarre card type "mana source" caused no end to confusion among my early play group as we were starting out in Magic. We thought that it stayed in play and could be tapped for 3 black mana every turn, which made for some ridiculous plays.
posts.html:
That this version was printed with the bizarre card type "mana source" caused no end to confusion among my early play group as we were starting out in Magic. We thought that it stayed in play and could be tapped for 3 black mana every turn, which made for some ridiculous plays.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Nagoragama (7/31/2011 5:27:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I believe that this is the only card to be printed with the "mana source" type. Getting magic from spells was always iffy in the old rules, and it wasn't until this point that they decided to make a special spell type for doing so. Shortly after Urza's Saga, Sixth edition would come out which would clear up such issues and do away with the "mana source" card type.
posts.html:
I believe that this is the only card to be printed with the "mana source" type. Getting magic from spells was always iffy in the old rules, and it wasn't until this point that they decided to make a special spell type for doing so. Shortly after Urza's Saga, Sixth edition would come out which would clear up such issues and do away with the "mana source" card type.
